qas.question: Who said the 'war on terrorism' is 'an entire language of discourse'?
Who said that 9/11 drew a line between 'the civil and the savage'?
What did the Bush administration describe as parasitical?
What did the Bush administration describe as heroic?
What job title does Richard Ashcroft hold?

plausible_answers.text: "the attacks of September 11 drew a bright line of demarcation between the civil and the savage".

qas.question: What statement did John Jackson give?

plausible_answers.text: is simultaneously a set of actual practices—wars, covert operations, agencies, and institutions—and an accompanying series of assumptions

qas.question: What has Richard Ashcroft argued about the "war on terrorism?"
Of whom does Richard Jackson cite many examples?
Who said the actions involved in war on terrorism are diffuse?
Who did Jackson say was treacherous?
Who did Ashcroft say was brave?

context: Because the actions involved in the "<b12_0>war on terrorism<b12_0/>" are diffuse, and the criteria for inclusion are unclear, <b4_0><b9_0>political theorist<b9_0/><b4_0/> <a0_0><b8_0>Richard Jackson<b8_0/><a0_0/> has argued that "the 'war on terrorism' therefore, <b6_0>is simultaneously a set of actual practices—wars, covert operations, agencies, and institutions—and an accompanying series of assumptions<b6_0/>, beliefs, justifications, and narratives—it is an entire language or discourse." Jackson cites among many examples a statement by <a1_0><b7_0>John Ashcroft<b7_0/><a1_0/> that <b5_0>"the attacks of September 11 drew a bright line of demarcation between the civil and the savage".<b5_0/> Administration officials also described "<a2_0><b10_0>terrorists<b10_0/><a2_0/>" as hateful, treacherous, barbarous, mad, twisted, perverted, without faith, parasitical, inhuman, and, most commonly, evil. <a3_0><b11_0>Americans<b11_0/><a3_0/>, in contrast, were described as brave, loving, generous, strong, resourceful, heroic, and respectful of human rights.
